column4: try apt-cache policy compiz-gnome and apt-cache policy compiz-plugins, what you're looking for is orgin: probably they come from different repos and conflict
maybe the bits are trying to escape?  (sorry, not a clue :)
no, vfat is fat16 or fat32 :)
are you copying to an ntfs/vfat partition?
those don't use unix file permissions, it's normal
using vfat as sort of a backup?
same thing for what we're talking about
do i need to preserve permission and owners?
it's never a bad idea; if you're just storing the files on the vfat for later return and use in ext3 __dean__ has the best advice
how do i tar it properly
I cd into the dir I'm saving in and   tar cf <filename>.tar /path/to/dir/to/archive
whats the difference between .tar and .tar.gz .tar.xy xz and so on?
right click the file, open with archive manager
but it does not show owner and permissions
